thread.title: Meridian Energy Group, Inc. Appoints Lance Medlin as its Executive Vice President of Projects

author: cnbc.com
title: Meridian Energy Group, Inc. Appoints Lance Medlin as its Executive Vice President of Projects
text:
BELFIELD, N.D., March 12, 2018 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Meridian Energy Group, Inc . the leading developer of innovative solutions for environmentally-compliant oil refining facilities, announced today that it has reached agreement with Lance Medlin as Meridian’s Executive VP of Projects. This appointment comes at a significant time for Meridian as the Davis Refinery ground-breaking quickly approaches. Mr. Medlin will oversee the detailed design, equipment procurement, fabrication and construction of the initial phase of the Davis Refinery, and the handoff of this facility to Thomas Johnson and the operations team that he is building in Belfield, North Dakota.
Mr. Medlin has an extensive background in the industry, having led successful projects for Shell, BP, Exxon, Petrofac, KBR, and Pemex. In such roles, he has served as a Vice President of Engineering and Projects, Project Executive, Project Director, and Commissioning & Start-Up Manager. Mr. Medlin is an Engineer with degrees in Mechanical Engineering and Organizational Management bringing with him over 20 years’ industry experience in Project Management in Chemical, Petrochemical, Oil & Gas Facilities Design, Construction and Operations. Mr. Medlin has led the management, planning, and direct supervision of day-to-day Civil, Mechanical, Industrial Construction and Process Engineering.
Meridian CEO William Prentice said of the selection, "Throughout the Davis Refinery project, Meridian has been very fortunate in attracting exceptional talent to move the company and its strategy forward, and Lance is no exception. As Meridian nears completion of the permitting process for Davis, the design and equipment procurement will accelerate, and field construction will commence as soon as the final Permit to Construct has been awarded by the North Dakota Department of Health. Lance is now in place to ensure that Meridian hits the ground running on this important project.”
Mr. Medlin had this to say, “Meridian Energy Group has introduced a game-changing facilities design that will lead the way to new jobs and cleaner, more efficient energy sources in a previously down-turned industry. I’m proud to be part of this forward-thinking team that will provide safe and sound leadership to a successful start of the Davis Refinery.”
About Meridian Energy Group, Inc.
The Mission of Meridian Energy Group, Inc. is to provide long-term shareholder value through the development and operation of the cleanest, most efficient and environmentally-compliant crude oil refineries in the world, benefiting the community and its investors. Established in 2013, Meridian is led by industry experts with a combined 500 years of world-class expertise in energy & hydrocarbon processing, project development, finance, and large capital project management. Meridian Energy Group, Inc. current headquarters is in Belfield, ND.
